definition[0]: kept in prison or in a place that you are not allowed to leave
example[2]: His son had been taken captive  (=became a prisoner) during the raid.
example[3]: a pilot who was held captive  (=kept as a prisoner) for six years
definition[1]: someone who is kept as a prisoner, especially in a war
definition[2]: captive viewers or customers watch a company’s advertisements or buy a company’s products because they have no other choice
example[4]: Kids in the classroom are a captive audience to whom ads may seem a welcome break from studies.
example[5]: Companies exporting to Third World countries often get a captive market for their goods.
